dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, it feels like the world is, uh, collectively moving on from COVID-19, right? Like, law enforcement and intelligence agencies, globally, are kind of shifting their focus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, it feels like the world is, uh, collectively moving on from C O V I D-nineteen, right? Like, law enforcement and intelligence agencies, globally, are kind of shifting their focus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Across the world, law enforcement and intelligence agencies are waging a different kind of war on COVID-19, one taking on scammers whore exploiting fear around the coronavirus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's generally true. But get this: the UK, specifically a branch of GCHQ, is actually *accelerating* their efforts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's generally true. But get this: the U K, specifically a branch of G C H Q, is actually accelerating their efforts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the U.K., an arm of the GCHQ intelligence agency, has spent the last month wiping COVID-19 crooks from the web...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Really? [interrupts] Huh, that's surprising. What are they, like, still doing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Really? Huh, that's surprising. What are they, like, still doing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the National Cyber Security Centre, the NCSC, they're still all in on, um, exploiting COVID-19 crooks from the web.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the National Cyber Security Centre, the N C S C, they're still all in on, um, exploiting C O V I D-nineteen crooks from the web.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the U.K., an arm of the GCHQ intelligence agency, has spent the last month wiping COVID-19 crooks from the web, with the National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) announcing Monday that it had taken down more than 2,000 scams in a single month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, like, how much are we talking? Are they still seeing a lot of scams?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, like, how much are we talking? Are they still seeing a lot of scams?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah. They announced they took down 2,000 scams in a single month! Which, apparently, is a significant reduction for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah. They announced they took down two thousand scams in a single month! Which, apparently, is a significant reduction for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The NCSC announcing Monday that it had taken down more than 2,000 scams in a single month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Two thousand! That's still a massive number. What kind of scams were those, you know, mostly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two thousand! That's still a massive number. What kind of scams were those, you know, mostly?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Everything, it seems! Fraudulent stores selling fake COVID-related stuff, malware sites, phishing attempts for personal info, advance-fee frauds...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Everything, it seems! Fraudulent stores selling fake C O V I D-related stuff, malware sites, phishing attempts for personal info, advance-fee frauds...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The swindles included: 471 stores selling fraudulent coronavirus related items, 555 websites trying to launch malware on visitors, 200 phishing sites seeking personal information such as passwords or credit card details, and 832 advance-fee frauds where victims are duped into handing over a set-up payment in the belief theyll get a large sum in return.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's, uh, quite a mix. Are they asking the public to help them, like, report these?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's, uh, quite a mix. Are they asking the public to help them, like, report these?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not really, no. The article says the public isn't being asked to help directly. But they *are* launching a new guide.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not really, no. The article says the public isn't being asked to help directly. But they are launching a new guide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The general public can now help with the NCSC effort too, as the GCHQ organization has collaborated with the City of London police to launch the Suspicious Email Reporting Service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, a guide! What's in it? Any, like, common sense stuff we should all be doing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, a guide! What's in it? Any, like, common sense stuff we should all be doing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! Things like turning on two-factor authentication, using three random words for important passwords, a separate password for your main email...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! Things like turning on two-factor authentication, using three random words for important passwords, a separate password for your main email...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Cyber Aware advice includes some rudimentary, simple and effective things people can do to be more secure at home, including: Turn on two-factor authentication for important accounts Protect important accounts using a password of three random words Create a separate password that you only use for your main email account

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Three random words, that's a good tip. People always struggle with remembering strong passwords.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Three random words, that's a good tip. People always struggle with remembering strong passwords.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And also, updating your software regularly, saving passwords in your browser, backing up data. Pretty, uh, rudimentary stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And also, updating your software regularly, saving passwords in your browser, backing up data. Pretty, uh, rudimentary stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Update the software and apps on your devices regularly (ideally set to automatically update) Save your passwords in your browser To protect yourself from being held to ransom, back up important data

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, criminals are still, for some reason, targeting us with COVID-19 themed scams even as the world moves on?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, criminals are still, for some reason, targeting us with C O V I D-nineteen themed scams even as the world moves on?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently! James Brokenshire, the UK security minister, said they're still exploiting our greater use of emails and video conferencing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently! James Brokenshire, the U K security minister, said they're still exploiting our greater use of emails and video conferencing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Criminals are seeking to exploit our greater use of emails, video conferencing and other technologies for their advantage, said the U.K. minister for security James Brokenshire.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And what about the US? I thought I heard something about them ceasing cooperation on something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And what about the U S? I thought I heard something about them ceasing cooperation on something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the NCSC and the US actually *stopped* cooperating on an alert about COVID-19 scams. Because, um, the list of 2,500 websites and emails they were putting out was just being ignored.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the N C S C and the U S actually stopped cooperating on an alert about C O V I D-nineteen scams. Because, um, the list of two thousand, five hundred websites and emails they were putting out was just being ignored.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier this month, the NCSC and the U.S. joined forces to issue an alert about COVID-19 scams, releasing a growing list of 2,500 websites and emails to watch out for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, effective internally, but less so with international warnings. That's, uh, quite the dichotomy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, effective internally, but less so with international warnings. That's, uh, quite the dichotomy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is. And here's another wild stat: cryptocurrency scammers? Their profits have surprisingly jumped up 33% in dollar terms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is. And here's another wild stat: cryptocurrency scammers? Their profits have surprisingly jumped up thirty three percent in dollar terms.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But in better news, though cryptocurrency scammers are taking advantage of the worlds focus on the coronavirus, their profits have actually dropped 33% in dollar terms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. So, while the focus shifts, some bad actors are just, you know, thriving in the background. That's a pretty grim takeaway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. So, while the focus shifts, some bad actors are just, you know, thriving in the background. That's a pretty grim takeaway.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really shows how adaptable these criminals are, you know? Always finding a new angle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really shows how adaptable these criminals are, you know? Always finding a new angle.
